As of current, this is the least fun i've had with a videogame.

Killers are almost unplayable with every survivor running Deadhard, DS, and other meta perks that make pretty much all killer suck besides the Meta 5 Killers that Behaviour refuses to nerf / bring other killer's that have consistently been low-tier up to their level.

Go buy Friday the 13th if you want a fun game that makes the killer actually scary.

It's been 3 Days since i started...

No Regrets.

danky as heck man

Game survives off of new players. Fun when you first start, but then when you realize how the game works, and how annoying perks can be against humans / monsters. TBH some of the monsters powers and or human perks feel like they are just their to frustrate the players (slow that team down) but regardless just comes off as frustrating and so that what we perceive it as such. And its like, why even bother you either get really FUN round or you get REALLY FUCKING TERRIBLE FRUSTRATING ONES.  I mean, half the game is just sitting there holding the mouse button... the other half is pressing the space bar every once in awhile but hey, take what you can get for a $20 game.
I always love playing this game and will always recommend. 10/10

I FUCKING LOVE THIS GAME
No maiden but def worth it

After reaching 666 hours I thought it was appropriate to finally leave my review. This game can be absolute hell. MMR was a complete shitshow. Playing killer is extremely stressful and solo queue survivor makes me wonder why I even play this games. Every patch brings game breaking bugs that take weeks to patch out. The balancing team has no idea what their doing and are extremely inconsistent on how they want to balance their game. One minute they're saying that the game isn't a competitive game and the next they are adding Skill Based Matchmaking. Perks and killers get nerfed for no reason and overpowered things have been out for months and the devs still haven't nerfed them. However even with all that I have had some amazing memories in this game since I bought it last year. Even with its problems I think that its an amazing game. As long as you're just looking for a casual game and don't go in thinking you are going to win every match then it is a lot of fun. I recommend playing the game with a group of friends in a SWF (survive with friends) group or in custom games as they are some of the most fun moments. This game has a lot of problems and the devs could definitely be doing a lot more but I still love it. If you can look past the game being imbalanced and are willing to commit some time to the grind (666 hours in and I still haven't unlocked all of the perks yet) then I definitely recommend getting the game.

They only listen to the streamers and content creators when it comes to fixing things. Don't plan on playing this game by yourself unless you want to play killer. They take it out on every killer and taunt you during the game. Its overall just a really toxic trashy money grab.

[h1] A cycle that never seems to end [/h1]

[b] Playing Hunter in DBD [/b]

As Hunter; it's just Not fun, it's really stressful. and I would rather play my favourite games than solo queue in DBD

[b] problems with the game [/b]

[list]
[*]This is a 1 versus 4, mostlikely you will be playing against survivors on a call, which isn't bad in any genral game only in the fact that it goes against the idea of how you would usually immerse yourself in a horror game versus a slasher in this case.
[*]The unspoken thoughts, once you've got Iridescent 1, the steam  achievement; Legendary Killer; then what is the point of training to maintain that of what you already have. while the season is still active and there won't be a new release for a while, what do you expect me to do DBD? i'm either going to stop, and start playing next month ... or just play as the friendly hunter getting dailies done each day? I actually have no reason to play the game after getting blood rank 1 because once you've got rank 1 you can only choose one of the ranks being hunter or survivor as a reward so there is no initiative. there is one back up and no nothing cumulative to keep me going.
[/list]

[i] Security issues; DDosing, hacks [/i]

[olist]
    [*]DBD has awful security issues, and because this game can't fix any of it's issues can't understand how a square fits into a space and the same for a circle and their only response is to PAY for a VPN, and of caurse this is every body's go to :L BUT ON A GAME? there are other games that have this issue and the fact that I HAVE TO USE a VPN to not get DDos-ed on DBD platform is one reason just to uninstall, one from many.
    [*]There are actualy survivors who i have played against and that are obviously cheating, either that be forcing a rubber-banding to happen or just playing with minor adjustments to ingame mechanics that aren't blatant enought to get them banned on report.
    [*]
[/olist]

is cool
fun
It's fun with friends. The survivors are the real killers.

I have almost 300 hours played.  The game can be fun, but 3 out of 4 matches as survivor usually suck.  Either you have a killer that just hook camps, ruining the game for that player, or you have teammates that don't play the game as a team.  There is a long match-making progress, and a long load time, so only 25% competitive / fun games is not a good payoff.

The game can be really fun if you have 2 or 3 friends to team up with, or you have a good killer that doesn't just catch one person, then stand next to them so they cannot be rescued.  If the developers would add some sort of penalty for this behavior, the game would be much improved.

I got one thousand hours of good cheap entertainment out of this one. Is it perfect? No, it's unlikely to ever become an E-sport. However, it is deeper than it looks, constantly evolving, and one of the most novel multiplayer experiences available at this time. Especially good for groups of friends.

Playing survivor is as fun (or even more fun) than playing killer, so be sure to try both roles. I wouldn't recommend playing high-level killer if you can't deal with pressure, though.

I like this game because it creates a thrill while playing against a killer or survivor. Very fun!
Ğ·Ğ±Ñ

Fun game at first, but the shine quickly leaves.

One of the worst 'competitive' experiences available on the market, which for a fundamentally PvP based game is bad.

Unbalanced game mechanics dictate the flow of each game, and malicious and unfair gameplay strategies plague lower ranks. Cheesy, gimmicky builds leave little room for outplay or counterplay on both sides. Incredibly unfun, MMR has made almost every game unfulfilling. 

The abhorrent grind just to have a vaguely competitive build on both Surv/Killer side is insane. Hundreds of hours required to achieve even a basic meta build. Game focuses on pushing microtransactions in the form of skins / currencies rather than investing in improved gameplay and user experience.

Avoid this one, VHS looks to be a better iteration on this genre.
